title: Indexing
description: Indexing organizes your document collection for efficient storage and retrieval, making it possible to quickly find relevant information.
whatItDoes: Indexing creates optimized data structures that allow for fast searching and retrieval of documents. It maps terms, vectors, or other features to the documents that contain them.
whyItMatters: Effective indexing is crucial for the performance and scalability of your RAG system. It enables quick retrieval of relevant documents from potentially massive collections.
challenges: Choosing the right index type for your specific use case
Balancing index size with query performance
Handling index updates as documents change
Scaling indexes to large document collections
